We've issued a #flood warning for Lower Frome from East Stoke to Wareham #Dorset, including East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham.  Full details here  https://t.co/unv4YcjCXP https://t.co/bs9fgWNOur
There are a number of #flood warnings in force across the South West this morning. Keep up to date with the latest, and stay safe. https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/8ApP0OAv9X

tweets.text:
It's not just champion boxer #AnthonyJoshua or Uncle Jim's #Christmas home brew that will knock you sideways...

#FLOODWATER can, too... 

üìΩÔ∏è MORE in our short video...
#floodaware #StormBella https://t.co/5GM312d8Be

Due to recent heavy rainfall, river #flooding is likely in parts of central and east England.

Always stay away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk now: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd

#StormBella https://t.co/d3sZWbkXBz

If you‚Äôre planning a big end of year clear out, be careful who you hire to dispose of your waste. Waste criminals pose as genuine waste collectors, take people's money but dump the waste illegally, putting our environment at risk.  

Share this video to let others know. https://t.co/NybBUaD4X8

@PaulBurrowsy @GsBrand @Elygroupofidbs @EnvAgencyAnglia Good tweets this week @PaulBurrowsy. Good amount of information to keep people informed üëè

Who knows.... I might be down in your patch soon enough & I already feel like I know parts of it ü§ì

@passedwonder @cllrrobwhite @EnvAgencySE Oops, 'most places' alongside the non-tidal Thames, i.e. upstream of Teddington. 
Central London *should* be OK, maybe @AlanBarrierEA can advise? üôè

He's just one of the many water company personnel across the UK working to keep your #water running during the #Covid19 outbreak.

Meet all our #keyworkers here: https://t.co/X7Ztgbtzyl

#Wave4Water https://t.co/yBKyfBtOy0

tweets.text:
‚ö†Ô∏è Road closures üì¢

We have a number of road closures in place currently across Worcestershire.

Check out the full list via the @worcscc Facebook page here: https://t.co/2xvEI04HPd https://t.co/eOyt4OoorN

With #StormBella creating heavy winds and rain, we‚Äôve been working around the clock to reduce the risk of #flooding and keep communities safe. 

Remain vigilant, check your #flood risk now: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/6WnFpkY9ff

@Trow_Fire_Stn @NJBailey888 @EnvAgencySW @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireWinter One of my volunteers has just come across the causeway and said it is still open (8pm) but fields well flooded either side and river still rising out there. Approach with caution.
Flood warning issued for Isle of Wight with immediate action required https://t.co/2EWniQALhw #IsleofWight #iwnews #IOW @EnvAgencySE
@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea @mat8iou
@Bidlet47 @DrAlexFord @EnvAgency https://t.co/aXs50fmgzK
We have operated the #Jubilee River to gate movement 1 ,this will alleviate  flows in the #Cookham area. @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea

@DrAlexFord Appalling.
@EnvAgency What do you do exactly?

@ashsmith43 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency If they were able to "process" more sludge - they would have to store more biosolids (very dangerous aka explosive) and then spread more on fields - (leaching pollutants back into streams and rivers) - they need to adopt alternatives - 
https://t.co/OXiHIHAjjC

@ThamesPathNT @cllrrobwhite @EnvAgencySE 'Most places' makes me want to go and check that Central London's still okay... üòâ OTOH, enjoying a well-earned day off after a *lot* of wandering in the last week, so I'll leave it 'till tomorrow to see the embankments are still there!

tweets.text: UPDATE 1130: our latest stats after the Christmas flooding. The situation is still dynamic so numbers will change as river peaks work thru main rivers and we gather intel. Sadly at least 300 flooded but over 9000 protected by defences and 18000 properties warned #StormBella https://t.co/l1uYsG5Cuz

The River Aire burst its banks this morning; here's a short clip of what would usually be agricultural fields instead are now one very big lake.
@RSPBAireValley @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/5v292VGMXy

My thanks to @bill_handley55 who kindly volunteered to door knock.  Tough time to be at risk of flooding but be assured that @EnvAgencyAnglia @CambsCC @CambsCops @cambsfrs @SouthCambs are all working closely to minimise impact and support residents where they need help

Water levels remain high in the county, particularly on the River Ouse. We have spoken to people in high risk areas and we will continue to patrol throughout the night. Please follow @EnvAgencyAnglia advice and keep up to date with warnings in your area: https://t.co/iY2lrvOkYa https://t.co/4hEEgt8pBL

Follow @EnvAgencySE pages and see which local areas are affected by #flooding  
https://t.co/kDNw7t4MOY https://t.co/cVIkM0JXxM

tweets.text:
If you are travelling this #Christmas make sure you stay #floodaware  

üöóDriving through flood water is the number one cause of death during flooding

üöó30cm of moving water can float your car 

üöóJust one egg cupful of water can wreck your engine

‚ùåDon't take the risk https://t.co/sOXTrF61X0
The path from Kennet Mouth #rdguk towards Meadow is flooded and impassable https://t.co/3FpfwuTjiM

tweets.text: We've issued a #flood warning for Tetbury Avon at Malmesbury #Wiltshire. River levels are rising at the Brokenborough river gauge. Areas most at risk are Goose Bridge and St John's Street. Find out more at https://t.co/Ph8RuOfsKA https://t.co/NvHGwxDxzU

A very small number of properties (7) in South Cambs may be affected by flooding on the edge of Earith tomorrow morning. This isn‚Äôt certain, but to be on the safe side we are currently door knocking and there will be regular patrols throughout the night to keep an eye out. https://t.co/IhQGXcW3gj

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - CEV Paul with the 15:00hrs report. River level at 27.45m and rising with @EnvAgencySW mini barriers in place and team supplied with mince pies. Packhorse Bridge now flooded. Take care around flood water @DWFRSBoA @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireWinter https://t.co/IaPI3QKIul
